intro: Chassalia stenothyrsa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved chassalia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in grassland and rocky habitats. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is often found in open areas with well-drained soil and is adapted to full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
